docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly ended its special session at Flushing Meadow at 2 P.M. yesterday after having formally established an eleven-nation committee of inquiry empowered to submit any proposals it desires for the solution of the problem...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly ended its special session at Flushing Meadow at 2 P.M. yesterday after having formally established an eleven-nation committee of inquiry empowered to submit any proposals it desires for the solution of the problem of Palestine.

headline.main: QUIET SOUGHT NOW; U.N. Assembly Calls for a Truce As It Votes Wide Palestine Study

docs.snippet: U.N. To Palestine Early next month at New York's La Guardia Field -- two and one-half miles away from the United Nations General Assembly Hall at Flushing Meadow -- a new chapter will open in the history of the U.N. A special U.N. investigation...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.N. To Palestine Early next month at New York's La Guardia Field -- two and one-half miles away from the United Nations General Assembly Hall at Flushing Meadow -- a new chapter will open in the history of the U.N. A special U.N. investigation commission of about 120 persons will take off in chartered planes for a flight across the Atlantic.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, May 17 -- The partition of Palestine is believed to be the most likely outcome of the United Nations Committee of Inquiry set up by the General Assembly this week with complete authority to bring in any resolutions it chooses.
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, May 17 -- The partition of Palestine is believed to be the most likely outcome of the United Nations Committee of Inquiry set up by the General Assembly this week with complete authority to bring in any resolutions it chooses.

headline.main: PALESTINE PARTITION SEEN AS MOST LIKELY SOLUTION; Alternatives Are Possible, but Sentiment Turns Toward Two Separate States

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 17 -- The United Nations Subcommission on the Freedom of Information and of the Press will begin its first session here tomorrow. Its task will be to draft an agenda and otherwise prepare for a conference, the goal of which...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, N.Y., May 17 -- The United Nations Subcommission on the Freedom of Information and of the Press will begin its first session here tomorrow. Its task will be to draft an agenda and otherwise prepare for a conference, the goal of which will be to adopt concrete measures for the attainment of world-wide freedom of information.

headline.main: FREE PRESS GROUP MEETS TOMORROW; U.N. Subcommission to Draft Plans for World Parley on Information

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, May 19 (U.P.) -- Meteorologists today predicted scattered clouds across the path of a total eclipse of the sun at 9 A.M. tomorrow. Thus months of preparations by scientists of eleven nations, waiting to make observations...
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, May 19 (U.P.) -- Meteorologists today predicted scattered clouds across the path of a total eclipse of the sun at 9 A.M. tomorrow. Thus months of preparations by scientists of eleven nations, waiting to make observations during the four minutes of total darkness, are threatened.
